fr.sorbonne_u.cps.dht_mapreduce.interfaces.management

Interface DHTManagementCI

  • All Superinterfaces:
    fr.sorbonne_u.components.interfaces.ComponentInterface, DHTManagementI, fr.sorbonne_u.components.interfaces.OfferedCI, java.rmi.Remote, fr.sorbonne_u.components.interfaces.RequiredCI

    public interface DHTManagementCI
extends fr.sorbonne_u.components.interfaces.OfferedCI, fr.sorbonne_u.components.interfaces.RequiredCI, DHTManagementI
    The component interface DHTManagementCI defines the services used to manage the form of the DHT, adding and removing nodes, updating the internal node information, etc.

    Description

    Invariants

     invariant       true        // no more invariant

    Created on : 2024-06-14

    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant

      compute the chords over the DHT ring.

      called within the process of computing the chords of all nodes in the ring (computeChords), get the reference to the node at offset from the current node in the ring; return null if no such node exist otherwise a SerializablePair<ContentNodeCompositeEndPointI, Integer> containing the end point to the node and the lower bound of the key hash for entries kept in this node and its followers in the DHT.

      make a pass over the DHT, merging adjacent nodes that total a number of stored entries under a threshold, and then sending a signal to the designated caller through the given end point when the pass has terminated.

      make a pass over the DHT, splitting nodes in two adjacent ones when the former has a number of stored entries over a threshold, and then sending a signal to the designated caller through the given end point when the pass has terminated.

        Description copied from interface: DHTManagementI
        called within the process of computing the chords of all nodes in the ring (computeChords), get the reference to the node at offset from the current node in the ring; return null if no such node exist otherwise a SerializablePair<ContentNodeCompositeEndPointI, Integer> containing the end point to the node and the lower bound of the key hash for entries kept in this node and its followers in the DHT.

 post    return == null || return != null && return.second() != null
